questions.question: I could answer only ………………………. questions.
questions.description: Few means almost none a few indicates a small number.

questions.question: She doesn’t have …………………………. friends in the city.
questions.description: Not any means the same as no.

questions.question: I haven’t got ………………………. money.
questions.description: Use much with uncountable nouns and many with plural nouns.

questions.question: I didn’t find ………………………….. there.
questions.description: Not anybody means the same as nobody.

questions.question: There are ……………………………. mangoes on the tree this year.
questions.description: Use fewer with plural nouns and less with uncountable nouns.

questions.question: He earns …………………………. money than I do.
She has …………………………… confidence in her skills.
questions.description: Use little with uncountable nouns and few with plural nouns.

questions.question: You have never given me …………………………… help.
questions.description: Use any with negative expressions like never, hardly etc.

questions.question: …………………………. money has been wasted on that project.
questions.description: Use much with uncountable nouns and many with plural nouns.
